name: src/drawer.canvasentry.js
CanvasEntry
description:
The `CanvasEntry` class represents an element consisting of a wave `canvas`
and an (optional) progress wave `canvas`.

The `MultiCanvas` renderer uses one or more `CanvasEntry` instances to
render a waveform, depending on the zoom level.

name: wave
description: The wave node

name: waveCtx
description: The wave canvas rendering context

name: progress
description: The (optional) progress wave node

name: progressCtx
description: The (optional) progress wave canvas rendering context

name: start
description: Start of the area the canvas should render, between 0 and 1

name: end
description: End of the area the canvas should render, between 0 and 1

name: id
description: Unique identifier for this entry

name: canvasContextAttributes
description: Canvas 2d context attributes

name: initWave
description: Store the wave canvas element and create the 2D rendering context

name: initProgress
description:
Store the progress wave canvas element and create the 2D rendering
context

name: updateDimensions
description: Update the dimensions

params.name: totalWidth
params.description: Total width of the multi canvas renderer

params.name: width
params.description: The new width of the element

params.name: height
params.description: The new height of the element

name: clearWave
description: Clear the wave and progress rendering contexts

name: setFillStyles
description: Set the fill styles for wave and progress

Fill color for the wave canvas,
or an array of colors to apply as a gradient

params.name: progressColor

or an array of colors to apply as a gradient

return.description: Returns a string fillstyle value, or a canvas gradient

description: Set the canvas transforms for wave and progress

description: Draw the actual rectangle on a `canvas` element

description: Draw a rounded rectangle on Canvas

params.name: halfH
params.description: Half the height of the waveform

The x-offset of the beginning of the area that
should be rendered

params.name: end

The x-offset of the end of the area that

name: drawLineToContext
description: Render the actual waveform line on a `canvas` element

params.name: halfH
params.description: Half the height of the waveform

params.name: start
params.description:
The x-offset of the beginning of the area that
should be rendered

params.name: end
params.description:

name: destroy
description: Destroys this entry

name: getImage
description:
Return image data of the wave `canvas` element

When using a `type` of `'blob'`, this will return a `Promise` that

When using the default `'dataURL'` `type` this

name: Init
description:
The HTML initialisation API is not part of the main library bundle file and
must be additionally included.

The API attaches wavesurfer instances to all `<wavesurfer>` (can be
customised), parsing their `data-` attributes to construct an options object
for initialisation. Among other things it can dynamically load plugin code.

The automatic initialisation can be prevented by setting the
`window.WS_StopAutoInit` flag to true. The `html-init[.min].js` file exports
the `Init` class, which can be called manually.

Site-wide defaults can be added by setting `window.WS_InitOptions`.

name: constructor
description:
Instantiate Init class and initialize elements

This is done automatically if `window` is defined and
`window.WS_StopAutoInit` is not set to true

name: src/mediaelement-webaudio.js
MediaElementWebAudio
description:
MediaElementWebAudio backend: load audio via an HTML5 audio tag, but playback with the WebAudio API.
The advantage here is that the html5 <audio> tag can perform range requests on the server and not
buffer the entire file in one request, and you still get the filtering and scripting functionality
of the webaudio API.
Note that in order to use range requests and prevent buffering, you must provide peak data.

name: src/plugin/playhead/index.js
DEFAULT_FILL_COLOR
description:
The playhead plugin separates the notion of the currently playing position from
a 'play-start' position.  Having a playhead enables a listening pattern
(commonly found in DAWs) that involves listening to a section of a track
repeatedly, rather than listening to an entire track in a linear fashion.

properties.name: returnOnPause
properties.description: Pausing the track returns the seek position to the playhead

used by wavesurfer to correctly instantiate the plugin.

name: src/util/request-animation-frame.js
src/util/silence-mode.js
ignoreSilenceMode
description:
Ignores device silence mode when using the `WebAudio` backend.

Many mobile devices contain a hardware button to mute the ringtone for incoming
calls and messages. Unfortunately, on some platforms like iOS, this also mutes
wavesurfer's audio when using the `WebAudio` backend. This function creates a
temporary `<audio>` element that makes sure the WebAudio backend keeps playing
when muting the device ringer.

The duration of the audio. This is used to
render the peaks data in the correct size for the audio duration (as
befits the current `minPxPerSec` and zoom value) without having to decode
the audio.

throws.description: Will throw an error if the `url` argument is empty.

name: loadBuffer
description: Loads audio using Web Audio buffer backend.

name: loadMediaElement
description: Either create a media element, or load an existing media element.

params.name: urlOrElt
params.description:
Either a path to a media file, or an
existing HTML5 Audio/Video Element

params.name: peaks
params.description:
Array of peaks. Required to bypass web audio
dependency

params.name: preload
params.description:
Set to true if the preload attribute of the
audio element should be enabled

name: decodeArrayBuffer
description: Decode an array buffer and pass data to a callback

params.name: callback
params.description: The function to call on complete

name: getArrayBuffer
description: Load an array buffer using fetch and pass the result to a callback

params.name: url
params.description: The URL of the file object

params.name: callback
params.description: The function to call on complete

name: onProgress
description: Called while the audio file is loading

name: exportPCM
description:
Exports PCM data into a JSON array and optionally opens in a new window
as valid JSON Blob instance.

params.name: length
params.description: The scale in which to export the peaks

params.name: noWindow
params.description:
Set to true to disable opening a new
window with the JSON

return.description: Promise that resolves with array of peaks

name: exportImage
description:
Save waveform image as data URI.

The default format is `'image/png'`. Other supported types are
`'image/jpeg'` and `'image/webp'`.

params.name: format
params.description:
A string indicating the image format.
The default format type is `'image/png'`.

params.name: quality
params.description:
A number between 0 and 1 indicating the image
quality to use for image formats that use lossy compression such as
`'image/jpeg'`` and `'image/webp'`.

params.name: type
params.description:
Image data type to return. Either 'dataURL' (default)
or 'blob'.

return.description:
When using `'dataURL'` type this returns
a single data URL or an array of data URLs, one for each canvas. When using
`'blob'` type this returns a `Promise` resolving with an array of `Blob`
instances, one for each canvas.

name: cancelAjax
description: Cancel any fetch request currently in progress

name: empty
description: Display empty waveform.

name: destroy
description: Remove events, elements and disconnect WebAudio nodes.

name: src/webaudio.js
WebAudio
description: WebAudio backend

name: scriptBufferSize
description: scriptBufferSize: size of the processing buffer

name: audioContext
description: audioContext: allows to process audio with WebAudio API

name: supportsWebAudio
description: Does the browser support this backend

return.description: Whether or not this browser supports this backend

name: getAudioContext
description: Get the audio context used by this backend or create one

return.description: Existing audio context, or creates a new one

name: getOfflineAudioContext
description: Get the offline audio context used by this backend or create one

return.description:
Existing offline audio context, or creates
a new one

name: constructor
description: Construct the backend

name: ac
description: ac: Audio Context instance

name: gainNode
description: gainNode: allows to control audio volume

name: analyser
description: analyser: provides audio analysis information

name: scriptNode
description: scriptNode: allows processing audio

name: destroyed
description: Boolean indicating if the backend was destroyed.

name: init
description: Initialise the backend, called in `wavesurfer.createBackend()`

name: setFilter
description: Unpacked `setFilters()`

params.name: filters
params.description: One or more filters to set

name: setFilters
description: Insert custom Web Audio nodes into the graph

name: createScriptNode
description: Create ScriptProcessorNode to process audio

name: createAnalyserNode
description: Create analyser node to perform audio analysis

name: createVolumeNode
description: Create the gain node needed to control the playback volume.

name: setSinkId
description: Set the sink id for the media player

unknown.tagValue:
{Promise} A Promise that resolves to `undefined` when there
are no errors.

params.name: deviceId
params.description: String value representing audio device id.

return.description:
A Promise that resolves to `undefined` when there
are no errors.

name: setVolume
description: Set the audio volume

params.name: value
params.description: A floating point value between 0 and 1.

name: getVolume
description: Get the current volume

return.description: value A floating point value between 0 and 1.

name: decodeArrayBuffer
description: Decode an array buffer and pass data to a callback

params.name: callback
params.description: The function to call on complete.

params.name: errback
params.description: The function to call on error.

name: setPeaks
description: Set pre-decoded peaks

name: setLength
description: Set the rendered length (different from the length of the audio)

name: getPeaks
description: Compute the max and min value of the waveform when broken into <length> subranges.

params.name: length
params.description: How many subranges to break the waveform into.

params.name: first
params.description: First sample in the required range.

params.name: last
params.description: Last sample in the required range.

return.description:
Array of 2*<length> peaks or array of arrays of
peaks consisting of (max, min) values for each subrange.

name: getPlayedPercents
description: Get the position from 0 to 1

name: destroyWebAudio
description: Destroy all references with WebAudio, disconnecting audio nodes and closing Audio Context

name: destroy
description: This is called when wavesurfer is destroyed

name: load
description: Loaded a decoded audio buffer

name: isPaused
description: Used by `wavesurfer.isPlaying()` and `wavesurfer.playPause()`

return.description: Whether or not this backend is currently paused

name: getDuration
description: Used by `wavesurfer.getDuration()`

name: seekTo
description: Used by `wavesurfer.seekTo()`

params.name: start
params.description: Position to start at in seconds

params.name: end
params.description: Position to end at in seconds

return.description:
Object containing start and end
positions

name: getPlayedTime
description: Get the playback position in seconds

name: play
description: Plays the loaded audio region.

params.name: start
params.description:
Start offset in seconds, relative to the beginning
of a clip.

params.name: end
params.description: When to stop relative to the beginning of a clip.

name: pause
description: Pauses the loaded audio.

name: getCurrentTime
description:
Returns the current time in seconds relative to the audio-clip's
duration.

name: getPlaybackRate
description: Returns the current playback rate. (0=no playback, 1=normal playback)

name: setPlaybackRate
description: Set the audio source playback rate.

name: setPlayEnd
description: Set a point in seconds for playback to stop at.

content:
# [wavesurfer.js](https://wavesurfer-js.org) [![npm version](https://img.shields.io/npm/v/wavesurfer.js.svg?style=flat)](https://www.npmjs.com/package/wavesurfer.js) ![npm](https://img.shields.io/npm/dm/wavesurfer.js.svg) [![Join the chat at https://gitter.im/katspaugh/wavesurfer.js](https://badges.gitter.im/katspaugh/wavesurfer.js.svg)](https://gitter.im/katspaugh/wavesurfer.js?utm_source=badge&utm_medium=badge&utm_campaign=pr-badge&utm_content=badge) Interactive navigable audio visualization using Web Audio and Canvas. [![Screenshot](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/katspaugh/wavesurfer.js/gh-pages/example/screenshot.png "Screenshot")](https://wavesurfer-js.org) See a [tutorial](https://wavesurfer-js.org/docs) and [examples](https://wavesurfer-js.org/examples) on [wavesurfer-js.org](https://wavesurfer-js.org). ## 10 years of wavesufer.js Wavesufer.js was started in March 2012. To celebrate the 10-year anniversary of wavesufer.js, we created an NFT representing the initial commit to this repository. If you're a company, or an individual, wishing to support the project, please consider buying this memorable commit. |[](https://opensea.io/assets/matic/0xE7ea2E2bE12C257d376400cB231D8eE51e972BD6/41246820351435245535444587687799096392219692760736652072803901002414398825025)|[Buy the first commit NFT ](https://opensea.io/assets/matic/0xE7ea2E2bE12C257d376400cB231D8eE51e972BD6/41246820351435245535444587687799096392219692760736652072803901002414398825025)| ---|---| The proceeds will go to the author and the current maintainer. ## Browser support wavesurfer.js works only in [modern browsers supporting Web Audio](http://caniuse.com/audio-api). It will fallback to Audio Element without graphics in other browsers (IE 11 and lower). You can also try [wavesurfer.swf](https://github.com/laurentvd/wavesurfer.swf) which is a Flash-based fallback. ## FAQ ### Can the audio start playing before the waveform is drawn? Yes, if you use the `backend: 'MediaElement'` option. See here: https://wavesurfer-js.org/example/audio-element/. The audio will start playing as you press play. A thin line will be displayed until the whole audio file is downloaded and decoded to draw the waveform. ### Can drawing be done as file loads? No. Web Audio needs the whole file to decode it in the browser. You can however load pre-decoded waveform data to draw the waveform immediately. See here: https://wavesurfer-js.org/example/audio-element/ (the "Pre-recoded Peaks" section). ## API in examples Choose a container: ```html
``` Create an instance, passing the container selector and [options](https://wavesurfer-js.org/docs/options.html): ```javascript var wavesurfer = WaveSurfer.create({ container: '#waveform', waveColor: 'violet', progressColor: 'purple' }); ``` Subscribe to some [events](https://wavesurfer-js.org/docs/events.html): ```javascript wavesurfer.on('ready', function () { wavesurfer.play(); }); ``` Load an audio file from a URL: ```javascript wavesurfer.load('example/media/demo.wav'); ``` ## Documentation See the documentation on all available [methods](https://wavesurfer-js.org/docs/methods.html), [options](https://wavesurfer-js.org/docs/options.html) and [events](https://wavesurfer-js.org/docs/events.html) on the [homepage](https://wavesurfer-js.org/docs/). ## Upgrade See the [upgrade](https://github.com/katspaugh/wavesurfer.js/blob/master/UPGRADE.md) document if you're upgrading from a previous version of wavesurfer.js. ## Using with a module bundler Install Wavesurfer: ```bash npm install wavesurfer.js --save # or yarn add wavesurfer.js ``` Use it with a module system like this: ```javascript // import import WaveSurfer from 'wavesurfer.js'; // commonjs/requirejs var WaveSurfer = require('wavesurfer.js'); // amd define(['WaveSurfer'], function(WaveSurfer) { // ... code }); ``` ## Related projects For a list of projects using wavesurfer.js, check out [the projects page](https://wavesurfer-js.org/projects/). ## Development [![Build Status](https://github.com/katspaugh/wavesurfer.js/workflows/wavesurfer.js/badge.svg?branch=master)](https://github.com/katspaugh/wavesurfer.js/actions?workflow=wavesurfer.js) [![Coverage Status](https://coveralls.io/repos/github/katspaugh/wavesurfer.js/badge.svg)](https://coveralls.io/github/katspaugh/wavesurfer.js) ![Size](https://img.shields.io/bundlephobia/minzip/wavesurfer.js.svg?style=flat) Install development dependencies: ``` npm install ``` Development tasks automatically rebuild certain parts of the library when files are changed (`start` wavesurfer, `start:plugins` plugins). Start a dev task and go to `localhost:8080/example/` to test the current build. Start development server for core library: ``` npm run start ``` Start development server for plugins: ``` npm run start:plugins ``` Build all the files. (generated files are placed in the `dist` directory.) ``` npm run build ``` Running tests only: ``` npm run test ``` Build documentation with esdoc (generated files are placed in the `doc` directory.) ``` npm run doc ``` If you want to use [the VS Code - Debugger for Chrome](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode-chrome-debug), there is already a [launch.json](.vscode/launch.json) with a properly configured ``sourceMapPathOverrides`` for you. ## Editing documentation The homepage and documentation files are maintained in the [`gh-pages` branch](https://github.com/katspaugh/wavesurfer.js/tree/gh-pages). Contributions to the documentation are especially welcome. ## Updating the NPM package When preparing a new release, update the version in the `package.json` and have it merged to master. The new version of the package will be published to NPM automatically via GitHub Actions. ## Credits The main maintainer: [Thijs Triemstra](https://github.com/thijstriemstra) Many thanks to [all the awesome contributors](https://github.com/katspaugh/wavesurfer.js/contributors)! ## License [![License](https://img.shields.io/badge/License-BSD%203--Clause-blue.svg)](https://opensource.org/licenses/BSD-3-Clause) This work is licensed under a [BSD 3-Clause License](https://opensource.org/licenses/BSD-3-Clause).
